ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Race to 60 (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: Lol, who cares, either way he didn t really earn 60.  He cheated to get it.  Not cheated as in broke any rules but definitely cheated the system to get ahead
ygData.messageBody:
Lol, who cares, either way he didn't really earn 60. He "cheated" to get
it. Not cheated as in broke any rules but definitely cheated the system to
get ahead of it. I refuse to congratulate, hold in awe, or respect someone
that finds pleasure in cheating the system. And I wouldn't be surprised if
he didn't have a RL friend or roomate that helped him keep the character at
it for longer than normal periods of time. Just because other people
weren't logging into the account doesn't mean that other people weren't
playing it ;)

Glad he's 60.

Hope he enjoys being there.

But... I don't find it all that surprising. Nor do I find it something to
be proud of or to respect someone for. Heh, everyone knows that FoH are a
pack of powergamers (very very GOOD powergamers). Not saying this is a BAD
thing, just that it isn't my style and that I don't respect someone for how
fast they can hit 60 ;)

Not to mention that he and Furor are total jerks if you ever have to deal
with them in game ;)

Lyrnia Jongleur
Bard of Norrath
Saryrn Server (and glad she got off Veeshan with her primary account)

----- Original Message -----
From: "Miriana" <miriana@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, May 12, 2000 12:54 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Race to 60 (OT)


> On Wed, 10 May 2000, Kevin L. Crawford wrote:
>
> > That ranger is a character, not a player. About 5 people played it 24/7
to
> > get it to 60 that fast. He's a member of FoH... need I say more?
> >
> Elderan was not played by multiple people. It was played by one
> person with 3 or 4 computers who twinked himself using other accounts. I
> heard Furor (formerly Kalaran, first level 50 on any server, in case you
> forgot) had people playing him, but really don't know too much about
> that situation.
>
> There's a LOT of rumors associated with this whole thing. I've
> heard stories such as "Elderan had 3 groups killing stuff down to a sliver
> then blurring it, so he was killing stuff with 2 or 3 swings, turning,
> killing another thing in 2 or 3 swings, and getting solo exp on all of
> them". Hehe. It's really kinda funny what people can come up with,
> especially on something so cheesy.
>
> --
> Miriana
> Legions of Darkness
> Innoruuk Server
>
>
